message.content:
cs.IT, cs.NI, cs.SY, cs.MM, cs.CE

Reasoning: 
1. cs.IT (Information Theory) - The paper discusses the optimal rate assignment and design criterion for space-time coding in MIMO-ARQ channels using information-theoretic measures. 
2. cs.NI (Networking and Internet Architecture) - The paper focuses on the performance limits and design of hybrid ARQ protocols in multiple antenna slow fading channels, which is relevant to wireless communication networks. 
3. cs.SY (Systems and Control) - The paper discusses the design of linear dispersion codes for MIMO-ARQ channels, which is related to control and optimization of communication systems. 
4. cs.MM (Multimedia) - The paper may be relevant to multimedia communication systems that use multiple antennas for transmission. 
5. cs.CE (Computational Engineering, Finance, and Science) - The paper involves optimization and design of communication systems, which may be relevant to computational engineering and science.
